column1:
The journal entries detail a range of experiences, both positive and negative. Positive experiences include recreational activities like driving a golf cart on Catalina Island, visiting a waterpark, enjoying international cuisines, planning trips with friends, reconnecting with loved ones, and starting new activities like swimming and learning Spanish. There were also professional achievements such as making progress on work tasks and attending interviews. 

On the other hand, there were several challenges. These include stress over visa appointments, personal decisions, and career doubts, poor sleep and unhealthy eating habits due to travel, neglecting wellness routines like taking supplements, physical activity, and therapy appointments, and procrastination on household chores and personal to-do lists. There was also a lack of progress on wellness coaching goals and certain educational courses.
